alert.note: Alert for Bay; Midland; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 2:37PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Bay, Midland and Saginaw. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EDT Monday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 233 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated persistent light to moderate rain across the region. This rain is expected to continue off and on through the evening hours. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen so far today. An additional 1 to 3 inches of rain is possible across the area late this afternoon through late evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Saginaw, Midland, Bay City, Frankenmuth, Chesaning, Auburn, St. Charles, Birch Run, Pinconning, Coleman, Sanford, Freeland, Kawkawlin, Essexville, Edenville, Zilwaukee, Bentley, Merrill, Oakley and Linwood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
